dir-section.heading: Railways
dir-section.p: There is a an underground railway in Athens. The Organismos Sidirodromon Ellados (Hellenic Railways Organization) owns and maintains most of the countryâ€™s railway infrastructure.

org-entry.content-note: fmrly known as Trainose SA, as a subsidiary of OSE SA; present name adopted in 2022

dir-section.heading: Roads
dir-section.p: In April 2023 the Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport signed agreements with the Greek companies GEK Terna SA, Aktor Concessions SA and INTRAKAT for the construction of new roads in Crete, to connect the cities of La Canea (Hania), Rethymno, Iraklion (Heraklion) and Agios Nikolaos.

dir-section.heading: Inland Waterways
dir-section.p: There are no navigable rivers in Greece.

org-entry.content-note: over 6 km long, links the Corinthian and Saronic Gulfs
shortens the journey from the Adriatic to Piraeus by 325 km; spanned by 3 single-span bridges, 2 for road and 1 for rail; can be used by ships of a maximum draught of over 22 ft and width of 60 ft

dir-section.heading: Shipping
dir-section.p: Greece controls one of the largest merchant fleets in the world. The principal ports are at Piraeus, Patras, Volos and Thessaloniki.

address.verbatim-address: South Patras Port, Akti Dimeon 107, 26333 Patras
Piraeus Port Authority, Akti Miaouli 10, 185 38 Piraeus

org-entry.content-note: majority stake sold to COSCO (Peopleâ€™s Republic of China) in 2016

dir-section.heading: Shipping Companies
dir-section.p: The following are among the largest or most important shipping companies.

org-entry.content-note: subsidiary cos include Blue Star Ferries, Superfast Ferries, Hellenic Seaways, ANEK Lines and the part-owned Africa Morocco Link
operates passenger and cargo ferry services between the Greek mainland and islands, and between Greece and Italy
operates passenger and cargo ferry services between the Greek mainland and Crete, and between Greece and Italy
specializes in the shipping of liquid petroleum gas

address.verbatim-address: Macedonia House, Leoforos Syngrou 367, POB 79122, Paleon Faliron, 175 64 Athens

org-entry.content-note: subsidiary cos include: Tsakos Shipping and Trading; Tsakos Energy Navigation; Tsakos Industrias Navales

dir-section.heading: Civil Aviation
dir-section.p: International airports include those at Athens, Eleftherios Venizelos-Spata, Thessaloniki, Alexandroupolis, Corfu, Lesbos, Rhodes, Kos and Iraklion (Heraklionâ€”Crete).

org-entry.found-date: 2009 in succession to state-owned Olympic Airways (f. 1957)
